alert.note: Alert for Osborne; Phillips; Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 06 at 3:52PM CDT until April 06 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 8 PM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the first High Wind Warning, northwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. For the second High Wind Warning, northwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one quarter mile and one mile in blowing dust. * WHERE...In Kansas, Phillips, Smith, Rooks and Osborne Counties. In Nebraska, Dawson, Gosper, Phelps, Furnas and Harlan Counties. * WHEN...For the first High Wind Warning, until 8 PM CDT this evening. For the second High Wind Warning, from 7 AM to 8 PM CDT Thursday. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, until 8 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. Damaging winds will blow down trees and possibly power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility may be highly variable due to areas of blowing dust. Use caution and be on the lookout for rapidly changing conditions.
info.instruction: Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. Remember, Pull Aside, Stay Alive. People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
